Rob Burnett, president of David Letterman 's production company Worldwide Pants, downplayed the comment to Newsday saying that David Letterman and Howard Stern are very rare entities in the world of show business in that most people leave their shows when they are told and these guys have the choice to leave their series. The official announcement states: Starting from April 4, Larry Page, Google Co-Founder, will take charge of Google's day-to-day operations as Chief Executive Officer. As for what Eric Schmidt will now do: Eric Schmidt will assume the role of Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership-all of which are increasingly important given Google's global reach. Internally, he will continue to act as an advisor to Larry and Sergey. There's still a few months to go until the change happens, but it's sure to dominate any Q&A sessions the top-tier of Eric Schmidt , Page and Brin have until that time. There's

The BBC's political editor Nick Robinson said Mr Oliver had no previous political involvement but had been approached by Mr Andy Coulson and had met the prime minister over the weekend. Mr Oliver said: I'm delighted and privileged to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time.`` My background is broadcasting, but I know that newpapers play a crucial role and I look forward to talking with them.`` It's difficult to leave the BBC after working here for five fascinating years- but this is an opportunity I can't turn down. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies. I don't think Eric Schmidt was pushed. I think he jumped, said Ken Auletta , author of`` Googled: The End of the World As We Know It.''`` I think Eric Schmidt is burned out.''
